flawed_nl_solution:
If it was 10 degrees hotter on this day in Miami than in New York, then the temperature in Miami was 80+10 = 90 degrees.
If it was 25 degrees cooler in Miami than in San Diego, then the temperature in San Diego was 90+25 = <<90+25=115>>115 degrees.
The total temperature for all the cities is 115+90+80 = <<115+90+80=825>>825 degrees
The average temperature of the three cities is 825/3 = <<825/3=275>>275 degrees
#### 275

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 285, not 825. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
